question: Can a distributed system maintain identity without a central controller? Yes/No and why in 1 sentence.
external_perspective: Yes, a distributed system can maintain identity without a central controller by using decentralized methods such as blockchain, peer-to-peer networks, or distributed hash tables (DHTs) to manage and verify identities.
